member.name: _SVSIF
member.summary: Indicates flags used by , , and to specify a type of selection to apply.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_EDIT
member.summary: 0x00000003. Put the name of the item into rename mode. This value includes SVSI_SELECT.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_DESELECTOTHERS
member.summary: 0x00000004. Deselect all but the selected item. If the item parameter is NULL, deselect all items.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_ENSUREVISIBLE
member.summary: 0x00000008. In the case of a folder that cannot display all of its contents on one screen, display the portion that contains the selected item.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_FOCUSED
member.summary: 0x00000010. Give the selected item the focus when multiple items are selected, placing the item first in any list of the collection returned by a method.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_TRANSLATEPT
member.summary: 0x00000020. Convert the input point from screen coordinates to the list-view client coordinates.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_SELECTIONMARK
member.summary: 0x00000040. Mark the item so that it can be queried using .

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_POSITIONITEM
member.summary: 0x00000080. Allows the window's default view to position the item. In most cases, this will place the item in the first available position. However, if the call comes during the processing of a mouse-positioned context menu, the position of the context menu is used to position the item.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_CHECK
member.summary: 0x00000100. The item should be checked. This flag is used with items in views where the checked mode is supported.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_CHECK2
member.summary: 0x00000200. The second check state when the view is in tri-check mode, in which there are three values for the checked state. You can indicate tri-check mode by specifying FWF_TRICHECKSELECT in . The 3 states for FWF_TRICHECKSELECT are unchecked, SVSI_CHECK and SVSI_CHECK2.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_KEYBOARDSELECT
member.summary: 0x00000401. Selects the item and marks it as selected by the keyboard. This value includes SVSI_SELECT.

member.name: _SVSIF.SVSI_NOTAKEFOCUS
member.summary: 0x40000000. An operation to select or focus an item should not also set focus on the view itself.
